Method Detail

from

public static Object from(org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptableObject scriptable,
                          boolean javaScript)
Converts JavaScript objects adhering to MongoDB's extended JSON to JavaScript and BSON types.

BSON types: {$oid:'objectid'}, {$binary:'base64',$type:'hex'}, and {$ref:'collection',$id:'objectid'}.

The {$date:timestamp} extended JSON format can be converted to either a JavaScript Date object or a java.util.Date object, according to the javaScript argument.

The {$regex:'pattern',$options:'options'} extended JSON format is converted to a JavaScript RegExp object.

The {$function:'source'} extended JSON format is converted to a JavaScript function object.

The {$long:'integer'} extended JSON format is converted to a java.lang.Long object.

Parameters:
scriptable - The JavaScript object
javaScript - True to convert the $date format to a JavaScript Date, otherwise it will be converted to a java.util.Date
Returns:
A BSON object, a java.util.Date, a JavaScript Date or null

to

public static Object to(Object object,
                        boolean rhino,
                        boolean javaScript)
Converts BSON, byte arrays, java.util.Date, java.util.regex.Pattern, java.lang.Long, and JavaScript Date, RegExp and Function objects to MongoDB's extended JSON.

Note that java.lang.Long will be converted only if necessary in order to preserve its value when converted to a JavaScript Number object.

The output can be either a native Rhino object or a java.util.HashMap.

A special "JavaScript" mode allows dumping JavaScript literals (for Date, RegExp and functions), though note this will break JSON compatibility!

Parameters:
object -
rhino - True to create Rhino native objects, otherwise a java.util.HashMap will be used
javaScript - True to allow JavaScript literals (these will break JSON compatibility!)
Returns:
A JavaScript object, a java.util.HashMap or null if not converted
